current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To designate certain Federal land in Chaffee County, Colorado, as a national monument and as wilderness.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Browns Canyon National Monument and Wilderness Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Browns Canyon National Monument and Wilderness Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in Chaffee County, Colorado, known as

text.#text: certain Federal land in the Pike and San Isabel National Forests and certain Federal land managed by the

quote.#tail: contain nationally significant biological, cultural, recreational, natural, wilderness, historic, scenic, riparian, geological, educational, and scientific values;

text.#text: Browns Canyon provides world class opportunities for fishing, hunting, boating, hiking, horseback riding, recreational gold-panning, picnicking, wildlife watching, and camping;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: while sustaining the local ranching economy would enhance the economic prosperity of local communities that depend on the area; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Browns Canyon National Monument and Wilderness Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: permanently protecting the values described in
designating the Browns Canyon National Monument and the Browns Canyon Wilderness would maintain and protect the world class recreational opportunities within the Arkansas Headwaters Recreation Area.
The purposes of this Act are—

to preserve the nationally significant biological, cultural, recreational, natural, wilderness, historic, scenic, riparian, geological, educational, and scientific values found within the National Monument;
to sustain traditional uses in the Browns Canyon area, including hunting, angling, livestock grazing, commercial outfitting, and boating;

to provide visitors the opportunity to enjoy and learn about the biological, cultural, recreational, natural, wilderness, historic, scenic, riparian, geological, educational, and scientific values and traditional uses of the National Monument;
to designate certain land within the National Monument as wilderness;
to protect important big game wildlife habitat and the backcountry character of certain National Forest System land within the National Monument that is not designated as wilderness;
to provide for cooperative management of the National Monument by the
to preserve the existing cooperative management of the Arkansas Headwaters Recreation Area.
In this Act:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 2(a)(22) of the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993

header.#text: Establishment of browns canyon national monument

text.#text: Subject to valid existing rights, there is established in the State the Browns Canyon National Monument to preserve the nationally significant biological, cultural, recreational, natural, wilderness, historic, scenic, riparian, geological, educational, and scientific values found within the National Monument.
The National Monument shall consist of approximately 22,000 acres of public land, as generally depicted on the Map.
be located at the edge of the Arkansas River; and
change according to the level of the Arkansas River.
In areas in which the Arkansas River is used as a reference for defining the boundary of the National Monument, the boundary shall—
Regardless of the level of the Arkansas River, no portion of the Arkansas River shall be included in the National Monument.
The boundary of any portion of the National Monument that is bordered by a road shall be set back 100 feet from the centerline of the road.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 2(a) of the Colorado Wilderness Act of 1993

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and 2,500 acres in the Pike and San Isabel National Forests, to be known as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that is formed by the Arkansas River or the railroad right-of-way shall be set back 150 feet inland on the East side and measured perpendicular to the Arkansas River or the eastern edge of the legal right-of-way of the railroad line, whichever is farthest East, but in no case shall the Browns Canyon Wilderness extend within 150 feet of either the railroad or the Arkansas River.

text.#text: The Secretaries concerned shall cooperatively manage the National Monument—

The Secretary concerned shall allow only such uses of the National Monument as the Secretary concerned determines would further the purposes for which the National Monument is established.

text.#text: Except as provided in
There shall be no curtailment of grazing in the National Monument or Wilderness simply because of a designation under this Act.

Any adjustments in the numbers of livestock permitted to graze in the National Monument or Wilderness shall be based on revisions in the normal grazing and land management planning and policy setting process, giving consideration to legal mandates, range condition, and the protection of range resources from deterioration.
the guidelines set forth in appendix A of the report of the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs of the House of Representatives accompanying

text.#text: The

Subject to such terms and conditions as the Secretary concerned determines to be appropriate, the Secretary concerned may undertake such measures as are necessary to control fire, insects, and disease—
in the Wilderness, in accordance with
in the National Monument, in accordance with—
this Act; and
any other applicable laws.

In accordance with any applicable laws and subject to such terms and conditions as the Secretary concerned determines to be appropriate, the Secretary concerned may prescribe measures to control nonnative invasive plants and noxious weeds within the National Monument and Wilderness.
Nothing in this Act—
affects the use or allocation, in existence on the date of enactment of this Act, of any water, water right, or interest in water;
affects any vested absolute or decreed conditional water right in existence on the date of enactment of this Act, including any water right held by the United States;
affects any interstate water compact in existence on the date of enactment of this Act;
authorizes or imposes any new reserved Federal water rights; or
shall be considered to be a relinquishment or reduction of any water rights reserved or appropriated by the United States in the State on or before the date of enactment of this Act.
With respect to water within the National Monument, nothing in this Act—
authorizes any Federal agency to appropriate or otherwise acquire any water right on the mainstem of the Arkansas River; or
prevents the State from appropriating or acquiring, or requires the State to appropriate or acquire, an instream flow water right on the mainstem of the Arkansas River.
Nothing in this Act diminishes the jurisdiction of the State with respect to fish and wildlife in the State.
The Secretary concerned may permit commercial activities (including outfitting and guide activities) within the National Monument and Wilderness, in accordance with—
this Act;

any other applicable laws (including regulations).
In accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , commercial services (including authorized outfitting and guide activities) are authorized in the Wilderness to the extent necessary for activities that fulfill the recreational or other wilderness purposes of the Wilderness.
and in consultation with the State, shall complete a comprehensive management plan for the conservation and protection of the National Monument and Wilderness.

text.#text: Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this Act, the
The management plan shall—
describe the appropriate uses and management of the National Monument and Wilderness in accordance with—
this Act; and
the purposes for which the National Monument and Wilderness are established;
be developed with opportunities for public input;
be prepared in close consultation with appropriate Federal, State, county, and local agencies; and
concentrate visitorship within the Arkansas Headwaters Recreation Area and the public land west of the Arkansas River.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , to the extent consistent with this Act, the Secretary concerned may incorporate any provision of any other applicable land management plan, including the Arkansas River Recreation Management Plan or a successor plan.
